tossups.question: This poet is paraphrased in Alfred, Lord Tennyson's poems "Eleanore" and "Fatima." A reconstructed poem by this author relates the story of Tithonus aging as a warning to young women, and is often called the "old age poem". This poet is the speaker of Algernon Swinburne's Anactoria. The book On the Sublime records one of only a few poems by this poet that survives nearly full. Anne (*) Carson translated slices of this poet's poems in the book If Not, Winter. This poet wrote that "all at once a subtle fire races under my skin" in her 31st fragment. Catullus translated that poem into Latin and called this poet "Lesbia". For 10 points, name this ancient Greek poet often called "The Tenth Muse", a woman from Lesbos.
tossups.answer: Sappho

tossups.question: When Wolbachia performs this behavior, it can induce parthenogenesis in various haplodiploid insects. Intermediate organisms affected by this behavior will often seek out high places which are exposed to predators. The “hyper” form of this behavior can involve koinobionts (“COIN”-o-bion-ts) targeting others present in a gall. The best known fungus to exhibit this behavior is Cordyceps (“CORD”-E-ceps). One pseudo-scientific theory holds that human affinity for (*) cats is a side-product of how this behavior affects rats exposed to Toxoplasma gondii (“GONE”-dee-i). The co-evolution triggered by this behavior can end in mutualism. This behavior is sometimes considered fractional predation. For 10 points, name this form of symbiosis in which one organism causes harm to a host.
tossups.answer: parasitism [or parasites; accept answers that indicate that an animal is the target of parasites or parasitic infection; accept host-parasite relationships, endoparasitism, ectoparasitism, hyperparasitism, or parasitoids; prompt on predation or predators before “predation”; prompt on symbiosis before read; prompt on infection with “by organisms which have what behavior?”]
tossups.question_sanitized: When Wolbachia performs this behavior, it can induce parthenogenesis in various haplodiploid insects. Intermediate organisms affected by this behavior will often seek out high places which are exposed to predators. The “hyper” form of this behavior can involve koinobionts (“COIN”-o-bion-ts) targeting others present in a gall. The best known fungus to exhibit this behavior is Cordyceps (“CORD”-E-ceps). One pseudo-scientific theory holds that human affinity for (*) cats is a side-product of how this behavior affects rats exposed to Toxoplasma gondii (“GONE”-dee-i). The co-evolution triggered by this behavior can end in mutualism. This behavior is sometimes considered fractional predation. For 10 points, name this form of symbiosis in which one organism causes harm to a host.
tossups.answer_sanitized: parasitism [or parasites; accept answers that indicate that an animal is the target of parasites or parasitic infection; accept host-parasite relationships, endoparasitism, ectoparasitism, hyperparasitism, or parasitoids; prompt on predation or predators before “predation”; prompt on symbiosis before read; prompt on infection with “by organisms which have what behavior?”]

parts: Name this two-carbon carboxylic (“car-box-ILL-ic”) acid. Though largely produced for industrial purposes, this substance is best known for being a major component of vinegar.
Acetic acid is formed from the carbonylation (“carbon-EEL-ation”) of this molecule in a chamber full of carbon monoxide. This alcohol is particularly cytotoxic to the neurons in the retina.

The penultimate step in acetic acid synthesis generates these compounds, which exist as an intermediate before their reactive atom is replaced by a hydroxyl. These electrophiles can add a carbonyl to an aromatic ring in the presence of a Lewis acid via a Friedel-Crafts reaction.

parts: This American poet asked "Might I but moor - tonight - in thee!" in her poem "Wild nights - Wild nights!" Other nautical poems by this "Belle of Amherst" and dash lover include "There is no frigate like a book."

At the end of Moliere's play Tartuffe, the central family is saved from losing all their possessions to the fraud Tartuffe by the intervention of what offscreen character?

bonuses.leadin: Answer the following questions about the questionable things some people put on pizza, for 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: Answer the following questions about the questionable things some people put on pizza, for 10 points each:
parts: A Swedish man who received 10 kilos of this fruit asked his local pizzeria to top his order with some slices and created a well-known Internet meme in the process. Despite originating in China, this fruit was commercialized in New Zealand and nicknames its residents.
Many pizza places in Serbia top pizza with ketchup and this other condiment. A specialty of the Italian town of Pesaro is a margherita pizza with this condiment and hard-boiled eggs.
In 2020, this chain released a Cheesy 7 Durian pizza in Singapore. This American company is the largest pizza chain in China, with over 2,000 stores.
